sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT copy (option*, source+, destination)> <!ATTLIST copy base CDATA #IMPLIED>
sect2.para: This element is an element of : |

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The element copy is one of the many main operation elements. The element copy is used to copy one or several source files and/or directories into a destination file or directory

The element option is optional and can be used one or many times to ensure the correct use of the cp command. The following is the currently supported list of options for the cp command :
archive (-a, --archive)
force (-f, --force)
no-dereference (-d, --no-dereference)
preserve (-p, --preserve)
recursive (-R, -r, --recursive) .
The element source is required and can be used many times to provide multiple source locations for a file.
The element destination is required and can only be used once. A copy can only have one destination.
The attribute base allows you to specify the directory in which the command is executed. See .

screen.userinput: echo Copying 'config.txt into /opt/mypackage/config.txt' cd /usr/src/mypackage cp -f config.txt /opt/mypackage/config.txt
